Heartbeat (1946) is an American romantic comedy directed by Sam Wood and starring Ginger Rogers, Jean-Pierre Aumont, Adolphe Menjou, and Basil Rathbone. With Rogers at the peak of her post-Academy Award career, Heartbeat captures the glamour and humor of mid-1940s Hollywood, now beautifully restored and colorized for modern audiences in the USA, Europe, and beyond.

Plot Summary:
The story follows Arlette Lafron (Ginger Rogers), a young runaway who flees a strict boarding school and winds up in the underworld of Paris. Taken in by Professor Aristide (Basil Rathbone), a polished but unscrupulous figure, she is trained in the art of pickpocketing. Arlette soon finds herself swept into high society when she attempts to steal from a wealthy diplomat, Ambassador De Grieux (Adolphe Menjou).

Instead of turning her in, the ambassador sees potential in Arlette and proposes a bold scheme: she must steal a watch from a young nobleman, Pierre de Roche (Jean-Pierre Aumont). But when Arlette and Pierre meet, romance quickly blossoms, complicating the plan and placing her loyalties in question.

Jean-Pierre Aumont, recently returned from serving in Free France during World War II, adds continental elegance to the cast. With supporting turns from Basil Rathbone and Adolphe Menjou, the film reflects Hollywoodâ€™s interest in romantic European settings during the postwar years.

sources.title: Heartbeat (1946) GINGER ROGERS
sources.description:
Stars: Ginger Rogers, Basil Rathbone, Adolphe Menjou
Director: Sam Wood

A young female escapee from a reform school joins a pickpocket academy in Paris. She is caught red-handed on her first attempt at stealing by an upper class man. He recruits her to do him a favor at a society party where she meets and falls in love with a young, handsome, rich diplomat. Whether or not she can land him is another story.
